proposed_strategy.description: This strategy groups consecutive primary structural units (Praśnas). Since the provided text is a single unit and its size is well below the safety limit, it forms a single chunk.

execution_plan.description: The entirety of the Sixth Praśna and its commentary.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Upanishad is canonically divided into six 'Praśnas' (Questions), which are the primary structural and thematic units.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: For mantras within a Praśna, extract the Devanagari numeral from the '।। [num] ।।' pattern that follows the bolded mantra text.

start_pattern.description: A new Praśna begins with a bolded heading indicating its ordinal number followed by the word 'प्रश्नः'.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Praśna is marked by a concluding line, typically indicating the end of that section's commentary or the section itself.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Content in square brackets immediately following a Praśna heading, like '[जीवस्य षोडशकलत्वं परमात्मोपासनं च]', should be parsed as a topic summary or metadata for that Praśna, not as part of the mantra content.
